questionText: What is an array in the C language?
options: A collection of elements of different data types
An ordered collection of elements of the same type
A special function for memory management
A data type for storing a single value

questionText: Which index is used to access the first element of an array in C?
What happens when you try to access an element outside the array's bounds?
options: The program will always terminate with an error
The compiler will prevent this error

questionText: How do you determine the number of elements in an array?
What is stored in an uninitialized array?
Which of the following statements about arrays in C are true? (Choose all that apply)
options: Array elements are stored in a contiguous memory area
The size of an array can be changed during runtime
An array can be passed to a function by value
correctAnswers: Array elements are stored in a contiguous memory area

questionText: How is an array different from a pointer in C?
options: An array has a fixed size, while a pointer can be reassigned
An array can store elements of different types

questionText: Write a line of code to declare an array of 5 integers named scores
How do you correctly declare and initialize a 2x3 two-dimensional array?
